data.description:
Last year’s SOLD OUT BYOB Christmas Lights Trolleys by HandCrafted are back by popular demand with an amazing new venue for the pre-party/pickup location! Perched atop the tallest building in Detroit’s historic Eastern Market, the 900 Tower + Terrace features panoramic international views of the Detroit and Windsor skylines.
 
Join us for a cozy pre-party on the roof in our heated tent with S’mores bar and amazing views of downtown Detroit. We will drink and be merry until the trolley arrives to pick us up at 6:30. Once we are all aboard, we will head to Wayne County Lightfest (Hines Drive) to take a drive through 4 miles of light displays, featuring over 100,000 lights. (If you were with us last year, don’t spoil the surprise drinking game we have here for our newbies ;) )
 
From Lightfest, we will venture to the Detroit Zoo to take in Wild Lights. Featuring more than 5 million LED lights on hundreds of displays, the Zoo transforms into a magical winter wonderland – perfect for a stroll with your sweetheart, or family and friends. Hot cocoa and warm snacks are available for purchase at various locations in the Zoo.
 
Our final destination will be beautiful Campus Martius. We listened to your feedback from last year, and have added additional time at both the zoo and Campus Martius, so take your time and enjoy a skate on the rink, a coney from Lafayette, or a hot toddy from any of the many bars surrounding the park. Downtown Detroit is beautiful this time of year!
 
Tickets are $75 each and include:
Round-trip transportation for the evening on one of our beautiful, heated trolleys
Entrance to the rooftop pre-party at the 900 Tower + Terrace in Eastern Market
Secured parking
Admission to Wild Lights at the Zoo
Souvenir Santa hat
Complimentary entertainment by our fantastic crew (if you were with us last year, you know this was the best part!)
 
Must be 21+ to attend this event. Tickets are nonrefundable but may be transferred to another individual. This event will take place rain/snow or shine, but in the case of extreme weather that prevents the trolley from running, ticket holders will be offered either a refund or tickets for a new date. Itinerary is subject to change based on wait times, traffic, or other reasons beyond our control, but we promise to show you a good time and plenty of Christmas lights no matter what!
 
***PLEASE NOTE: Wild Lights at the Zoo will not be available on the following dates, and an alternate stop will be planned (likely the Big Bright Light Show in downtown Rochester): 11/30, 12/7, 12/13, and 12/14.
data.name: BYOB Christmas Lights Trolley Tour + Rooftop Party

data.description:
TIER PRICING:
Purchase tickets....
- from now until December 6: $30
- Dec 7-Dec 18: $35
- Dec 19 - Dec 30: $40
- Door price: $45

Snapchat: Joeymiao
Venmo: @Joey-Ramone
Chase Quickpay:yourbffljoey@gmail.com (don't shame me please)
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Thanksgiving has come and gone, do you know where you will be blacking out this New Year's Eve?

After some soul searching we agreed it would be unfair to deliver anything but amazing plans for New Years to all of you beautiful people. This 3,000 square foot loft ,just blocks from Bryant Park, simply offered the venue for shenanigans. Why not invite all of our friends to a party with its own floor(a place where the event manager said "You can be as loud as you'd like" since all other floors are under construction)?

For the low low price of $30 you will be getting access to a newly renovated loft with a 20x20 foot projector to watch the ball drop on! The whole space has wifi(if you routinely run out of data) and surround sound speakers(even in the bathrooms)! 

Not sure what your alcohol situation is? We even solved that.. kind of! You can bring your own alcohol or you can take advantage of the bartender we have rented for the evening! We even got the venue to throw in a free drink voucher for everyone in attendance. There is also a rumor that those who pay earlier will have first access to extra drink vouchers(Joey told Isobel and he got the green light from the venue so its basically the bible).

You and all of your friends are welcome just ask the hosts to add them to the event. We invited you because somewhere along the way we became friends so we trust you to invite those who will maintain a certain level of ratchetry that is tasteful. 

The earlier you get there the more time you have to make poor decisions, and the greater the likelihood you will get a parking spot! Wear something sparkly, we will be dressed to be found in a semi lit smoky room easily. If you have any questions feel free to message either of us.

This event can be paid for through venmo, snapchat, or chase quickpay(No this event was not an elaborate excuse for me to advertise my snapchat you haters).
data.name: JoeyXIsobel NYC NYE Loft Party: 2017 SCAMMED ME

data.description:
Join Argosy Cruises for the Christmas Ship™ Festival 3rd Annual Parade of Boats official onshore viewing party on Friday, December 15th from 7:30pm to 9:30pm at Evanston Plaza in the Fremont Lake Union Center (off of Evanston Ave North and North Northlake Way)! Decorated boats from all over the region convene and promenade around Lake Union, then travel westward through the Fremont Cut. The Dickens Carolers will also perform from aboard the official Christmas Ship™ as she sails through the Fremont Cut, past the viewing party.
 
Warm106.9, Seattle's Christmas Station, will be onsite along with Allan and Ashley from their hit morning show, Mornings With Allan and Ashley, helping judge the decorated boats featured in the parade. Plus, YOU can cast your vote for the People’s Choice Award on Argosy’s Facebook page! Take in the glittering procession and make sure to stop by the WARM 106.9 tent to snap a selfie with Wendell the Bear and say hello to the WARM team. Snag a free giveaway and enter to win holiday prizes, all while supplies last!

This event is FREE to attend!
data.name: 3rd Annual Parade of Boats Viewing Party

The 4th annual "Night Lights" Preview Party is an exclusive evening kicking off the Austin Trail of Lights’ holiday season in style!  This is your chance to enjoy Austin's favorite holiday event with a little extra sparkle — and support the Trail of Lights Foundation and it’s STARS at the Trail program while you’re at it.

Night Lights Entertainment Schedule
7:10 – 7:45 – Mother Falcon String Trio 
8:00 – 9:00 pm – Whiskey Shivers
9:00 – 10:00 pm – DJ Mel 

Guests will enjoy Night Bites tastings from Sway, Wu Chow, Mattie's, Moonshine Patio Bar & Grill, Cabo Bob's Burritos, Chilantro BBQ, Texas Honey Ham Company, Top Notch Hamburgers, La Pera, H-E-B Cafe Mueller and more! Plus, get a jump on your holiday shopping Edible Austin's curated Maker’s Market featuring copper goods from Sertodo Copper, handmade jewelry by VINCA, The Turtle Restaurant chocolates, Jaime's Spanish Village, Lick Honest Ice Creams and more!

In addition guests have access to a beer & wine open bar, cocktail tastings, complimentary amusement rides and an exclusive sneak peek of the Austin Trail of Lights before the public! 

Experience the Trail of Lights like never before!  Tickets can be purchased for $75 and proceeds go towards the Trail of Lights Foundation’s STARS at the Trail program. Visit our website at austintrailoflights.org to purchase tickets (on sale November 8, 2017) or for more information.

You won’t want to miss this special night!

DTLA Proud invites you to our second annual DTLA Proud Block Party at Night On Broadway in front of Precinct at 4th and Broadway! 

If you are missing the #DTLAProudFestival as much as we are, then join us on Saturday, January 27th for a FREE night of performances, music, and art highlighting the diverse LGBTQ+ community of DTLA. 

Prepare for a night of drag, dancing, and most importantly community gathering in a fun and safe space amongst the 75,000+ people who attend Night on Broadway!

You will not want to miss it!

Stay tuned for our line-up! We will announce it soon, promise! 

 -

 #NightOnBroadway is a free arts and music festival produced in celebration of Councilmember José Huizar’s Bringing Back Broadway economic development initiative.

Like never before, Night on Broadway awakens beautiful historic theatres and the blocks between them along the Broadway corridor in Downtown Los Angeles. L.A. is a mecca for creative talent of all kinds, and Night on Broadway is where it all shines – right in the heart of entertainment’s birthplace in Los Angeles. 

From emerging musical acts to national stars, artists to acrobats, and fashion designers to food trucks, Night on Broadway is all about the City of Angels.

http://nightonbroadway.la/about/

-

DTLA Proud is committed to growing and celebrating the diverse LGBTQ+ community in Downtown LA through volunteerism, partnerships, and events. 

We are #DTLAProud 🌈💖🏙 

www.dtlaproud.org

Join a beautiful crowd at Stage48 and get painted in reds, yellows, greens, pinks and enjoy the Festival of colors in style with food, drinks, and the amazing beats by NYC's Top Entertainers.

Welcome to the happiest day party in New York City! The Festival of Colors celebrates the coming of spring, the joy of friendship, and equality for all. This Indian Festival happens ever year, not only in India but throughout the world. Join us on Sunday March 11th or Saturday March 17th. This is a day & night event and all nationalities and ethnicities are encouraged to participate!

Make sure to wear white because this party gets colorful. The colored powders used in Holi represent happiness, love, and the freedom to live vibrantly. Take the opportunity to cover yourself and your friends in colorful powders and dance your heart out. Enjoy musical performances, delicious food, and an afternoon of messy, color fun! Hope you all can make it!

data.description:
Cuddle Party™ czyli “Chodź się przytul!”

Czym jest Cuddle Party™? 

To impreza przytulankowa - wydarzenie na którym dorośli (18+) eksplorują własne umiejętności komunikacji, uczą się stawiania granic ale przede wszystkim doświadczają dotyku w bezpieczny, nie-seksualny sposób. Na spotkaniach odbywających się od 12 lat na świecie w lekki i przyjemny sposób osoby dorosłe odkrywają swoje potrzeby dotyku i uczą się jak je komunikować, ale też jak mówić NIE. 
Efektem ubocznym uczestnictwa jest zalanie falą oksytocyny, dobrego samopoczucia i doskonałego humoru. 

Po co się przytulać? 

Badania pokazują, że konsensualny dotyk jest niezbędny dla dobrego funkcjonowania układu krwionośnego, układu nerwowego, zdrowia emocjonalnego. Dotyk buduje poczucie własnej wartości, umiejętność ufania sobie i innym i szacunek dla siebie i innych. Wyzwala kreatywność i poczucie bezpieczeństwa. Jako dorośli, często jesteśmy pozbawieni dotyku świadomego i konsensualnego, a tym samym pozbawiamy się korzyści z niego płynących. 

My, ludzie, potrzebujemy dotyku, który nie jest seksualny (chociaż ten też jest super, ale to inna impreza). 

Cuddle Party™ to również warsztat na którym w łatwy i przyjemny sposób nauczysz się stawiania granic, mówienia “tak” czy “nie” (“nie wiem” znaczy “nie” jeśli chodzi o dotyk), komunikowania tego, czego chcesz. Warsztat prowadzony jest przez Facylitatora certyfikowanego lub będącego w trakcie certyfikacji przez międzynarodową organizację Atlas Spooned, (organizacja założycielska), w naszym przypadku to Izabela Dziugieł http://izabeladziugiel.com/ Cuddle Party Facylitator (nr certyfikatu 120 - PS. Jak ją znacie, to wiecie, że uwielbia się przytulać!).

Nasze Cuddle Party™ :

Logistyka: 
•	data: 09.12 
•	godz.17.00 do ok. 20.30
•	miejsce: ul. Bartycka 18, 00-716 Warszawa 
•	Opłata: 100 zł (wynajem sali, poczęstunek) 
•	przychodzimy punktualnie (by zapewnić poczucie bezpieczeństwa i atmosferę zaufania, drzwi zamykane są 5 min po czasie, czyli o 17.05 - jeśli wiesz, że się spóźnisz, daj nam znać odpowiednio WCZEŚNIEJ)
•	zaczynamy przedstawieniem się, ustaleniem zasad spotkania, poćwiczymy nasze umiejętności stawiania granic, pośmiejemy się eksperymentując różne rodzaje komunikacji własnych potrzeb
•	a potem już “free-style”! Możesz robić co chcesz w ramach zasad ustalonych na spotkaniu. Pamiętaj tylko o konsensualnym, nie-seksualnym dotyku! Możesz też nie przytulać ani nie być przytulanym.
•	Ubranie: przede wszystkim WYGODNIE, możesz przebrać się na miejscu, nawet w pidżamę, golizna jest zabroniona! Możesz przynieść ulubiony kocyk czy podusię! 
•	Możesz przyjść w parze, albo bez pary. Zasady obowiązują wszystkich!


Zapisy:
Bezpośrednio na izabela.dziugiel@gmail.com (nie rezerwuję miejsc - potwierdzeniem uczestnictwa jest przelew na konto, którego nr otrzymasz w mailu) 
Zapisy kończą się 06.12! Nie spóźnij się! Później (jeśli są miejsca - z reguły nie ma) cena wzrasta do 150 zł - early bird gets the worm ;)

As I'm sure you're well aware, we're approaching 10 years since that rager at Corey's place. Thought we could all reunite for a little catch up, 10 years on!

Would love to see how we all are, so feel free to bring your partner and/or kids along. It'll be BYO again and if you could each bring a plate of something as well that would be fantastic.

Still sorting out entertainment for the night, at the moment we've locked in some big names from that era that have stood the test of time; Operator Please, The Potbelleez, Sam Sparro, Gabriella Cilmi and DJs will be spinning the Ministry of Sound 2008 annual (loads more TBA).

In regards to location, we're still waiting on confirmation from Corey that this is actually happening, but it'll be somewhere in Narre Warren again.

RSVP asap and easy on plus 1's, as per usual.

data.description:
Cinespia presents
HOME ALONE + Pajama Party
Sunday, December 17th
Los Angeles Theatre

Our Annual Holiday Party!

90s wunderkind Macaulay Culkin stars as know-it-all Kevin McCallister, who lives the childhood dream when he wakes up to find his typically bustling house (with worrisome mother, irritating uncle, bully of an older brother) all gone. Accidentally left behind from the family trip, Kevin lives it up with endless junkfood and all access to his brother Buzz’s secret stash of sports cards and Twinkies. 

What starts out as the perfect staycation quickly becomes a battleground when two conniving burglars (Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern) try to run a suburban con. 

Full of hijinks and hilarity, this ingenious film written by John Hughes and directed by Chris Columbus, still is the biggest holiday hit. 

Grab your Talkboy and join our pajama party in an opulent movie palace. Show up in your PJs (your fun day best) for an ice cream bar to end all ice cream bars and a photo studio for the 90s kid inside! DJs, live music, bars (21+ w/ valid ID) Pajamas or holiday attire strongly suggested.
http://bit.ly/2zaamr3

data.description:
ALL ABOARD! The magic of the Polar Express arrives at Newport on the Levee for the Polar Express Pajama Party on Saturday, December 16 & Sunday December 17! Tickets are just $8.

Visitors are greeted at the door with a train ticket, hot cocoa, cookies, and popcorn. 

Kids (and adults) can attend attend in their PJs! Pajamas, blankets, and stuffed animals are encouraged!

Enjoy the movie in the former IMAX Theater located in the Valet Circle next to Brio Tuscan Grille. Doors open at 4:15 p.m., and the Movie will begin @ 5:00 PM and lasts 1 hour and 30 minutes. 

After the movie, receive a bell just like the one in the movie and experience a snowy wonderland once you step outside!

 Tickets will go on sale Wednesday, November 29 at 8 a.m.! 

 

Just a few reminders for this event:

*Movie will be shown on smaller screen, not IMAX size.

*The doors open at 4:15 p.m. Please bring confirmation of your ticket purchase for entry, and have your entire party with you. Complimentary popcorn, cookies, and hot cocoa will be provided. If you wish to bring additional snacks or drinks you may, but we would like to encourage everyone have beverages in resealable bottles.

Assortment of: Chocolate Covered Strawberries, Cheese Cake, Brownie, Cannolis



No Refunds
21+ Event (Have Formal ID)
Email organizer directly with questions

 



















Directions:

Getting Dropped off
If getting dropped off by taxi, you would take lower Randolph St. east until it ends at the
lakefront which is DuSable Harbor. There is a turnaround at the foot of Randolph where it
meets the lake. If dropped off at the turnaround you will walk down to the path along the lake
and continue north towards the River and end at the yachts. Taxis can also go inside to the
end of the DuSable Harbor Parking lot and drop off. If they are there for less than 15
minutes, there is no charge. GO ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF PARKING AREA TO GET CLOSER TO THE BOAT!

 

Driving

 From the West

Take 90/94 (Kennedy) to the Ohio St. Exit. Take Ohio St. East to Columbus Dr. Take a right
onto Columbus Dr then a left onto lower Randolph St. Take Randolph St. east until it ends at
the lakefront which is DuSable Harbor. Take a left and immediately look for signage on your
left hand side saying "DuSable Harbor Parking- Anita Dee Yacht Charters" turn left into the
entrance of DuSable Harbor parking lot. Drive straight ahead and take a ticket and drive
through the gate to the end of the lot. Once parked, exit parking lot to lakefront. Both yachts
are docked on the Chicago River straight ahead and to your left. GO ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF PARKING AREA TO GET CLOSER TO THE BOAT!

 

From the North
Take Lake Shore Drive and exit Randolph St. Turn left onto Randolph St. east until it ends at
the lakefront which is DuSable Harbor. Take a left and immediately look for signage on your
left hand side saying "DuSable Harbor Parking- Anita Dee Yacht Charters" turn left into the
entrance of DuSable Harbor parking lot. Drive straight ahead and take a ticket and drive
through the gate to the end of the lot. Once parked, exit parking lot to lakefront. Both yachts
are docked on the Chicago River straight ahead and to your left. GO ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF PARKING AREA TO GET CLOSER TO THE BOAT!

 

From the South
Take Lake Shore Drive exit Randolph St. Once you pass the Randolph Street light,
immediately look for signage on your left hand side saying "DuSable Harbor Parking- Anita
Dee Yacht Charters" turn left into the entrance of DuSable Harbor parking lot. Drive straight
ahead and take a ticket and drive through the gate to the end of the lot. Once parked, exit
parking lot to lakefront. Both yachts are docked on the Chicago River straight ahead and to
your left. GO ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF PARKING AREA TO GET CLOSER TO THE BOAT!

 

From the Loop
From Michigan Ave. and Randolph Street, go east on Randolph, be sure to take Randolph
underground which is lower Randolph until it ends at the lakefront which is DuSable Harbor.
Take a left and immediately look for signage on your left hand side saying "DuSable Harbor
Parking- Anita Dee Yacht Charters" turn left into the entrance of DuSable Harbor parking lot.
Drive straight ahead and take a ticket and drive through the gate to the end of the lot. Once
parked, exit parking lot to lakefront. Both yachts are docked on the Chicago River straight
ahead and to your left. GO ALL THE WAY TO THE END OF PARKING AREA TO GET CLOSER TO THE BOAT!

 

*Depending on time/day of the week parking ranges from $6 winter rate.














 

  What to know

This offer is final sale and nontransferable
May not be combined with other offers or promotions
Must be 21+ to purchase
We stay compliant with state issued liquor laws

Voucher is redeemable only at the event; after the event date, the voucher expires and has no redeemable value

You've worked hard and now it's time to party hard! Celebrate the end of term with the biggest blowout this side of the M25 with a headline act (to be announced) dropping some of their biggest hits.

TICKET INFORMATION

£12 Advance

£15 Door Entry

ENTRY GUARANTEE

Tickets will guarantee you entry into the venue until 11pm, after this time entry will be dependent on venue capacity until midnight.

TRANSFERRING A TICKET

Online tickets may be transferred at the door, on the night of the event, between 10pm and 11pm. Transferals outside of this time need to be completed in person at the wristband exchange - tickets cannot be exchanged any other way. You cannot transfer a ticket and then come back to the event later unless you purchase an additional ticket. If transferring on the door, you will need to enter the SU once you have transferred your ticket.

The person whom you are transferring your ticket to must be present. Please remember that you are responsible for any guests you sign in even if you transfer your own ticket and do not attend.

WHAT TO DO WITH YOUR E-TICKET

Your College Card will automatically have your ticket added to it once payment is completed online. You simply need to turn up with your College Card and photographic proof of age ID (driving licence, passport, PASS card or government ID) or a signing in wristband and the person who signed you in if you are a guest.

If you feel more comfortable printing your ticket, that’s fine but it’s not needed (and is probably more environmentally friendly if you don’t!)

SIGNING IN A GUEST

Guests need to be signed in at any of the following locations and times:

Union Helpdesk - Midday to 5pm

Tommy's Kitchen - 5pm to 8pm

Medicine - 6pm to 10pm

This can only be done on the night of the event. They cannot be signed in on the door of the SU.

FAST TRACK ENTRY

If you want fast track entry on the night you can exchange your e-ticket for a wristband on the day of the event. These will take place in the following locations:

Union Helpdesk - Midday to 5pm

Tommy's Kitchen - 5pm to 8pm

Please note that additional ticket holders need to be present when exchanging for a wristband and wristbands must be placed on your arm at the time of collection. We cannot refund any wristbands that are lost between collection and the event start so please look after your wristband.

UpYerRonson returns for its third and final shindig of the year with our annual Christmas Blowout Party! 
Friday 22nd December, or 'Mad Friday' as it's affectionately known, has been chosen for our new date! It tends to be the official start to everyone's Chirstmas and with many putting the 'Out of Office' signs up for a few days at least, it seems like the perfect time to get well and truley Ronsoned! 

We will be taking over the Mint Club in Leeds from 8pm-4am. With their Watergate inspired, state of the art floor to ceiling LED Lighting Rig and Funktion One Sound System, it's no wonder it won "Best Small Club" at DJ Magazine's, Best of British Awards in 2010.

***A complimentary glass of fizz or drinks token will be on offer to anyone who arrives before 9pm***

FULL DJ LINE-UP:

Brandon Block & Alex P (Back2Back)

Supported by our Ronson Resident DJs: Marshall, Paul Murray, Neil Metzner, Andy Ward, Lee James, Garry Dabill

We can't wait to get Ronsoned this Christmas with our extended Ronson family! 

See you all on that dancefloor....Big love from Team UYR! 😍

data.description:
Let's make Spirits Bright! Join the Suds Monkey family in celebrating the most wonderful time of the year. 

This is going to be our biggest and last party of the year and we are pulling out all the stops. 

The best feedback we got from our Halloween and Grand Opening Party was that there was plenty of attractions to safely entertain the kiddo’s, while the parents could chat and enjoy themselves. 

Our Christmas Party on Saturday, December 16th will be bigger and better! 

Please be sure to register yourself as going (it helps us estimate and prepare) and PLEASE SHARE with Friends and Family to help make this the best party of the year. We can’t do it without You 😊 

Some of the attractions include (Pictures in Event Discussion): 
•	Candy Land Obstacle Course
•	Big red Chair
•	Gift Box Jumper
•	Giant snow flurry machine
•	Human Snow Globe
•	Santa Sumo Suits
•	Pony and Reindeer Riders
•	Games And more

Dig out those ugly sweaters...or Pj's for the littles and get ready for some big fun all day long for all ages. There will be Family power hours between 3 to 6 p.m.  featuring seasonal music from Tommy Mojica, Free cookies from Lock Tite, hot cocoa and so much more. 

Food from Mind of Massaro and Taco Brother, Hot Drinks and treats  from Le Muse, and Feel Butter Baby Buns

If you enjoyed our Halloween party then you know this is not to be missed... or if you missed it, here is your chance to enjoy some Suds fun.  

Bring your cameras for some photo ops.  

More details to come.

It's Time for Table Games Madness!
Like table games? Love to win big? At GSR we want to reward our table games players with weekly chances to win prizes galore - so over the next three months we will be giving away over $50,000 in CASH and PRIZES!

Beginning this November, Club Grand members can earn entries into the weekly drawing by having a qualifying hand during live table games play. Drawings will be held every Sunday when we will be giving away $300 in cash to five lucky winners, with the first drawn winner pre-qualifying for the Grand Finale Drawing on January 28, 2018. The Grand Prize? A 24 month lease on a 2018 Lexus RX 350 F-Sport, or a take home cash prize of $15,000!

It's back!  The $5 A Bag Blowout Book Sale.

Even though we haven't had much cold weather, you're probably starting to run low on your winter reading. Never fear... the Friends of WFPL are here!

It's simple. We'll give you a brown paper bag, place whatever books you can fit inside, and pay $5 for each bag you fill. Buy as many bags as you want... bring a wheelbarrow or a truck and shop the day away!

As always, your contributions will support the West Florida Public Library's efforts to build community and improve literacy.

data.description:
Festivity is a contemporary Thai performance inspired by a traditional ceremony from the northern region of Thailand where villages celebrate during a parade called ‘Hae Krua Tan.’ The performance incorporates physical movements and exhibition to create an understanding of how Thai people embrace this special parade. #mappingmelbourne @multiculturalartsvic Find out more here: http://multiculturalarts.com.au/event/mapping-melbourne-2017/

Director and Choreographer: Nakarin Jaikla
Music Composer: Nampark Sribanditmongkol
Production Assistants: Candice Boonjua
			Khwanlarp Sudjunta
Photographer: Nachnicha Kongkatigumjorn
Videographer: Bhavin Mettanant
Performers: 6 Performers
1.	Candice Boonjua
2.	Khwanlarp Sudjunta
3.	Wichittra Changchaya
4.	Shuchinthara Suebsamarn
5.	Saranya Chaovarad
6.	Ampornkarn Artanyoota

Festivity การแสดงไทยร่วมสมัยในเทศกาลศิลปะร่วมสมัยนครเมลเบิร์น

ผลงานการแสดงแบบไทยร่วมสมัย Festivity ในเทศกาลศิลปะร่วมสมัยนครเมลเบิร์น หรือ Mapping Melbourne Festival 2017 แสดงโดยคนไทยในเมืองเมลเบิร์นจากกลุ่มศิลป์โปรดักชั่น SILP Productions Inc. ที่มาร่วมสร้างสีสันให้กับเทศกาลในปีนี้ โดยนำเอารูปแบบการแห่ครัวทาน หรือ ครัวตาน ทางภาคเหนือของประเทศไทยมาประยุกต์ใช้ในผลงานชิ้นนี้ ซึ่งออกแบบและควบคุมผลงานโดยคุณนครินทร์ ใจกล้า ผู้ก่อตั้งและผู้อำนวยการของศิลป์โปรดักชั่น บทเพลงที่นำมาใช้แสดงนั้น ได้เรียบเแต่งและบรรเลงขึ้นมาใหม่ โดย คุณนำภาค ศรีบัณฑิตมงคล นักแต่งเพลงและนักดนตรีฝีมือพระกาฬที่จะมาร่วมสร้างผลงานนี้ให้มีความลึกซึ้งมากยิ่งขึ้น 

Festivity เป็นงานที่นำเอาประเพณีแบบไทยภาคเหนือมาประยุกต์ใช้ในเชิงศิลปะสมัยใหม่ นำเอาความเป็นไทยมาผสมผสานกับการเต้นแบบตะวัน โดยนำเอารูปแบบการฟ้อนรำ การเต้นสนุกสนานแบบลูกทุ่งไทย รวมทั้งความเชื่อทางวัฒนธรรมไทยมารวมเข้าไว้ด้วยกัน โดยรูปแบบการแสดงจะเน้นการเคลื่อนไหวของร่างกายที่มีผสมผสานความอ่อนช้อยแบบไทย ใช้ความหนักแน่น ฉับพลันแบบตะวันตก เพื่อสร้างความแตกแต่งของการใช้ร่างกาย เสื้อผ้าเครื่องแต่งกายนั้นได้ออกแแบและทำขึ้นมาใหม่ เพื่อมาเสริมให้การแสดงนั้นมีความน่าสนใจมากยิ่งขึ้น ผสมกับการเล่าเรื่องผ่านการใช้อุปกรณ์ประกอบการแสดง ซึ่ง Festivity เป็นการแสดงที่มีความยาว 30 นาที แต่ก่อนที่จะมีการเริ่มการแสดง ทีมนักแสดงจะเริ่มเดินขบวนพาเหรดตั้งแต่บริเวณสวน Alexandra ผ่านมายังบริเวณ Southbank Promenade และมาสิ้นสุดที่ลาน Queen Bridge Square ในช่วงเวลาประมาณ 18:30 - 20:00 น.  
วัน เสาร์ ที่ 16 ธันวาคม 2560 

ติดตามผลงานของ ศิลป์โปรดักชั่น
สามารถติดตามได้ทางเฟชบุ๊คเพจ www.facebook.com/silpproductions หรือทางอินสตาแกรมที่ @silp_productions

data.description:
HELLO FRIENDS,

CHRISTMAS FESTIVITY SEASON IS HERE!

We have our Christmas festive night!

DATE: Saturday 9th December

WHERE: Cafe Nero

With: 
Lara Martin is a singer/songwriter from the United Kingdom. Lara is best known for her songs God is Here, The Voice of Hope and Divine Exchange. More recent songs include Be With Me, Between Trapezes and Soothe from her latest album Pearl.
Lara is also a public speaker and gives talks at various conferences, events and churches.  She has a unique way of combining her gift in music with telling stories from her own experiences in life.  Her message is one of hope. 
Lara lives in Yorkshire with her husband Jon and their two children. In 2014, Lara, in partnership with International Children's Charity World Vision, launched a brand new series of events called Embrace.  These evenings of praise and worship are held in churches all across the UK.  Lara also supports Saying Goodbye – remembrance services for babies lost through miscarriage, still birth or infancy and often sings in their services held in cathedrals around the UK.

Lara hosts 'Pearl Nights', which are intimate nights of acoustic music combined with story telling and biblical truths.

On the night you can buy tea, coffee and cake.
Plus Lara will have her CD’s for sale. 

EXCELLENT gifts to buy people for Christmas.

Free-will offering taken on the night. To help bless and cover Lara’s expenses.

We look forward to seeing you there.

data.description:
[PT]
De acordo com o calendário escolar, o sábado, 16 de Dezembro, é o último dia de aulas antes da paragem para as férias do Natal. 
Desta forma, vimos por este meio fazer o convite para o convívio de Natal na Escola Portuguesa de Kingston no sábado, 16 de Dezembro, no qual teremos a oportunidade de conviver antes da paragem do Natal.
A festa será das 11.00 às 12.00, pelo que os alunos da nossa escola só deverão comparecer às 11.00.
Pedimos a vossa colaboração para o seguinte:
1.	Pedimos que compareçam com uma camisola vermelha ou verde e um gorro de Natal, se possível;
2.	Pedimos que colaborem com um doce ou um prato típico do Natal, sem frutos secos (a escola é um local sem a presença de alergénicos de frutos secos), para que possamos partilhar;
3.	Pedimos que cada pai ou mãe se responsabilize pelas bebidas quer do seu/sua educando, quer dos membros da sua família que participarão neste convívio.
Não se esqueçam que não só esperamos que os alunos participem, assim como toda a família está convidada! Teremos todo o gosto em que convide qualquer pessoa que poderá estar interessada em se juntar a nós para a nossa festinha de Natal.
Esperamos vê-los lá!

[EN]
According to the school calendar, Saturday, 16 December, is the last day of classes before the Christmas break.
So, we are hereby inviting you and your family to the Christmas festivity event at the Kingston Portuguese School, in which you will have the opportunity of getting together before the Christmas break.
The Christmas festivity will be from 11.00 a.m. to 12.00p.m., so the students should only come at 11.00.
We ask for your cooperation with the following:
1.	Please wear a red or green sweater and a Christmas hat, if possible;
2.	We ask that you contribute with a typical Christmas sweet or dish, without nuts (the school is a nut-free environment), so that we can share;
3.	We ask that every parent also brings drinks for their children and any other family member who wishes to participate in this Christmas festivity.
Don’t forget that we hope that not only the students participate, but the whole family is invited as well. You are welcome to invite anyone who may be interested in joining us for our Christmas get-together.
We hope to see you there!
data.name: Convívio de Natal - 2017 - Christmas Festivity event

Reece Samuels, pseudonym Abnormal Sleepz', is an Artist & Producer/DJ hailing from the city of Manchester. 
His influences are Hip Hop, Soul and Grime. You can catch him as one of  BPM's (Big People Music) main hosts where he has gained rapid recognition for his dominance, energy and lyrical abilities over 140 BPM on the electric stage.
2016 saw the release of "The Meditape 2" 
Early 2017 saw Sleepz go on tour, with a packed out show at Band on the Wall. 
abnormalsleepz.bandcamp.com/album/the-meditape-two

KinKai  🐘
Flow theory member and lyrical genuis, Kinkai has very a unique sound. Kai’s latest lead single ‘Roll the Dice’ received attention across the nation, premiering with Complex Magazine, attracting Majestic Casual and debuting on radio stations such as Rinse FM, BBC 1xtra and others around the country. Listen here >> .youtube.com/watch?v=KWvlIZ6B45o

A Broken Camarilla  🐝🐝🐝🐝
A diverse collective of musicians, songwriters, beat makers and microphone controllers, creating a new spectrum of sound for the party people. Fusing together electronic foundations with Hip-Hop, R&B and UK Bass music, the group have been performing and creating together since 2015 where they met at university. Also working as solo artists under the Alias’s Evabee, Joey Bricks, Ceeow, and Tommy Tickle, the group’s eclectic tastes and visions help to pave the windy road forward.
ABC recently performed for 1Xtra at Media City...
youtube.com/watch?v=N8yohVO5zMw

Flash Sampson 🦇 - **RESIDENT SHINDIGGER DECK LORD** 
Flash Sampson has played on Legacy and Limbo Radio bringing a range of sweet musical selections bridging genres including Neo-Soul, hip hop, afro beat and Jazz Funk. But he is no stranger to the club having played house, garage, DnB at nights such as Bite the Badger, Hit and Run, Ghosts of Garage and Punx Inna Jungle. He has supported artists such as Jenna and the Gs, Sticky, IAMDDB and Artful Dodgers with his personal blend of riddims to get the crowds skanking at any BPM
mixcloud.com/limboradio/limbo-radio-flash-sampson-7th-july-2017/

El Statiko  🐉 - Guest DJ
El Statiko is Manchester based Turntablist / DJ who specializes in Hip Hop, Funk and Live Remixing. He DJ’s for several Manchester Hip Hop groups such as Mothership Connection and The Natural Curriculum (TNC) and is also a resident of Taste the Diff’rence. Away from playing for groups and doing parties he competes in international DJ championships such DMC and IDA, having achieved the title of IDA UK champ twice and IDA world runner up. 
facebook.com/ElStats/videos/836624416497160/


ART EXHIBITORS 🎨

Hippiezilla  🐇
With abstract and colourful, smooth flowing projections, Corina Biebere's (Hippiezilla's) art is certainly not to be missed. Her art has been showcased in venues such as Band on the Wall, at events with the Merkai Collective & Synthesis Manchester.
instagram.com/hippiezilla/?hl=en

MAYAMOTHI  🦊
"Ella photographs black people" -Ella's Mum
instagram.com/mayamothi/?hl=en

Kyle Huggins  🐊
Birmingham born Kyle Huggins, found his way to Manchester on the recommendation of the city's uniqueness from a friend. However, it wasn't till his final year of university that he turned his hand to photography. Taking part in his first public display Kyle is displaying some favourite pictures.
instagram.com/kylehuggins/?hl=en

Patrick J Clifton 🐫
Patrick is an illustrator hailing from the depths of Old Trafford. He has always drawn influence from comics and graffiti, and is just starting out a career in illustration and design. He is mostly known for his work with Leanin', but he has also done work for Mary & Archie and A Broken Camarilla, amongst others.

And for kicks, join us at 8:00pm on the dance floor to learn original jazz moves created by swing royalty and which propelled the decadent and rebellious socialites of the roaring 1920s.

data.description:
The stock market is soaring and we are going to crank up the Victrola, and party like it's 1928! 

Throw caution to the wind and enjoy prohibition-era cocktails, music, food and dancing, as we transport you back in time to the Jazz Age. 

This is certainly not your grandfather's bathtub gin! Our friends at Corgi Spirits have brought finely crafted spirits and cocktails to Jersey City, and to celebrate, they have graciously offered to host the Jersey Art Exchange's (JAX) December fundraiser. All proceeds will help to fund JAX's afterschool Teen Art/Technology Programs.

Come out to Corgi Spirits at the Jersey City Distillery, Thursday, December 14 to enjoy some fine cocktails, music, and food at this hip new Jersey City institution and support a worthy cause. Admission to the fundraiser is $50 at the door, and includes 1 free drink ticket, 1 raffle ticket, appetizers, and other surprises. You are encouraged to wear prohibition-era attire if you feel the spirit move you!

Ticket Price: $45 online; $50 at the door
Can't make it to the event but you would like to Donate?
You can donate here: https://thejax.online/product/donate

Just opening in October, Corgi Spirits is already widely regarded as the hottest gin joint in all of Jersey with some of the most inventive and nuanced cocktails in the NYC metro. Check out their cocktail menu, http://www.corgispirits.com/cocktails/ and read about them in Forbes: http://bit.ly/2Azo1EF

All proceeds from this event will go to the Jersey Art Exchange (JAX), a Jersey City arts and technology center located on Monticello Avenue that provides afterschool programs for local teens, including free music lessons, media and technology workshops and a safe place to call their own. JAX is a registered 501(c)3 nonprofit. Find out more about JAX at http://thejax.online/

The evening's musical entertainment is brought to you by Richie P and the Jersey City Swingers. Led by trumpeter Rich Polatchek, and featuring pianist Will Dougherty, bassist Pete McCullough, and drummer Noel Sagerman, the JC Swingers will have you dancing all night to the sounds of the swing era.

Michael Cumella (aka Phonograph DJ MAC) will be spinning vintage records on antique phonographs at the JAX December 14 fundraiser, giving our Speakeasy Shindig additional prohibition-era flair. DJ MAC has been involved in collecting, restoring and sharing crank-up phonographs for over 30 years. As a recognized expert on the acoustic era (1890-1925) of our recorded history, MAC has been host of The Antique Phonograph Music Program on WFMU since 1995 playing these disc and cylinder machines live "on the air" for an international audience. As the creator of the Phonograph DJ concept, MAC has traveled nationally and internationally for events. MAC is also active in buying, selling and restoring phonographs and makes house calls to diagnose machines. Find out more here: http://michaelcumella.com/phonographdj/index.html

data.description:
It's back!!!

Singalong… Jam Session… Hootenanny…
Whatever you want to call it…The WEDNESDAY SHiNDiG is a night celebrating COMMUNITY MUSIC where YOU help provide the tunes. Bring along your voice box and perhaps your own music maker* to hoot/holler/pick/strum/shake or noodle along with songs written by some of the all time greats. Creedence, Eagles, Crowded House, Dylan, Yusuf and Bowie to name a few, as well as some classic southern American folk and fiddle tunes, led by the talented and passionate Evergreen Music Team. Lyrics/chords/melody lines provided... you just rock up ready to play!

Some "open jam" nights can be cliquey... but not an Evergreen SHiNDiG! No audition required, no pressure to be involved...but certainly anyone willing to have a go is WELCOME, just pull up a barstool and you're in the band! You only know three chords??? That'll get you pretty far at a SHiNDiG! 

If playing music isn't your thing, you may like to come along just to sip on a tasty 4 pines beer and soak up some wholesome Northern Beaches Community atmosphere... but be careful not to sit there too long... as you may be at risk of joining in!

So it's about time to dust off that mandolin, re-string that guitar and get down to the 4 Pines Truck Bar in Brookvale on Wednesday 6th December for a night celebrating the joy of community music. Don't miss THE WEDNESDAY SHiNDiG!

*MUSIC MAKER for a SHiNDiG is something acoustic...
Acoustic guitar, mandolin, banjo, acoustic bass, fiddle, accordian to name a few examples of 'music makers' that have appeared at our previous SHiNDiGS. If you have any more questions or want some more information don't hesitate to contact us info@evergreenmusic.com.au
data.name: The Wednesday SHiNDiG

data.description:
Smugglers Records are set to host an Xmas shin-dig at Ramsgate Music Hall

Featuring a line-up that delivers a double-bill of established and up and coming acts.
---------------------------------------------
Cocos Lovers with support from The Selkies
---------------------------------------------
Channelling influences from real and imagined corners of the globe, Cocos Lovers (pronounced Co-Coss) operate well beyond the remit of alt-folk. Their music swells with glorious widescreen melodies, and seismic beats. They’ve earned a reputation for fantastic live performances with an ever-changing instrumental line-up of mandolin, acoustic and electric guitars, violin, musical saw, flute and a unique blend of drums and percussion. The latest incarnation of the Cocos sound sees a healthy step into more electric realms.

The Selkies are a contemporary folk-fusion duo from rural Kent featuring Nou Helm and Flo Stirrup. Both share multi-instrumental duties of ukulele, guitar and vocals. The young duo have recently celebrated the release of their stunning debut EP on Smugglers Records.
---------------------------------------------------
Djs bookend the show keeping the joyous Christmas spirit in our toes!
data.name: Smugglers Records Xmas Shindig – Cocos Lovers

data.description:
The DekkerTones present an Xmas Shindig + Special Guests - Friday 29th December - Main Stage at Bedford Esquires

The DekkerTones are lining up a little Christmas treat to help you skank and dance off the turkey, with the sounds of Ska music across the decades.

The 9 piece Ska band liven up crowds with their mix of Ska, Trojan Reggae, RockSteady and a little 2Tone for good measure, all delivered with plenty of energy and heartfelt authentic style.

Tina and Mick lead from the front on Vocals interlaced with cool and easy Horn section in the hands of Drozzer on Trumpet (an ex Ska master) , Pete on Tenor and Soprano Saxophone and Nick on Trombone

Chopping, grooving and soaring melodic rhythms are safe in the hands of Taz on Keys and Andy on Guitar. All underpinned by the two Dave’s – Driscoll on Bass and Probert on Drums providing serious traction from the engine room.
 
Special guest DJ support from DR SKA, rocking the decks before, during and after the show.

We are sure to move you! so come down and get Some!

--------------------------------

Tickets priced £10 in advance are on sale via Seetickets here:
http://www.seetickets.com/event/the-dekkertones/bedford-esquires/1136166

Also available in person from Bedford Esquires Bar, Slide Record Shop and Mario’s Hair design in Kempston

The almost-annual event that began in 1999--the couple took one year off for the birth of their twins— has become a tradition for their family and the families of their fans. 

Bruce’s and Kelly’s holiday performance finds the husband-and-wife duo of singer-songwriters with a full band singing songs from their Christmas album Happy Holidays. But the show isn’t all about the holidays, it is also a showcase of the best of Kelly and Bruce’s solo careers which continue to flourish with their new CD.

Bruce says the shows each year are very special to the couple because of the way it brings back memories, “You think about the people you love, friends, family, how lucky you are to have known them.” He understands the wistfulness of the season and the dream of a Christmas that may have never been.

#HolidayShindig

The 6th Annual Bubbe's Old-Fashioned Hanukkah Shindig!

Seattle's biggest and best Hanukkah party for the mazeldicker yids & friends! Featuring a cast of the PNW's brightest MOT mazeltov cocktails and klezmorim that could make even Yiddish Vaudeville chaleshen.

====

Seattle's biggest and best Hanukkah party for the mazeldicker yids & friends is back! The Debaucherauntes' 6th edition of oldschool Hanukkah meshuggas is really raising the bar, bringing in new artistic faces and groups, and building bridges between Jewish and Roma communities for a night of music, dancing, burlesque and circus that would make your wildest Bubbe verklempt. Celebrate the 5th night of Hanukkah in Yiddish Vaudevillian style with 4 PNW Jewish, klezmer, and Roma party bands to make you tanz tanz tanz all night long. Punctuated by a handful of the best PNW Jewish burlesque and circus, and rounded out with a latke cart and traditional community menorah lighting by a fire dancer, you and your whole mishpacha might find yourself screaming along in the mameloshen before you know it. 

Get Ready for the Hanukkah event of the year! With support from  TDHS - The Tribe, PAVE Seattle, The Jewish Federation, and Jconnect Seattle.

Bruce says the shows each year are very special to the couple because of the way it brings back memories, “You think about the people you love, friends, family, how lucky you are to have known them.” He understands the wistfulness of the season and the dream of a Christmas that may have never been.

data.description:
Holy Habits - its the World's foremost all-lady Monks tribute band, The (Sometimes 'Ye') Nuns make a very welcome return for their fourth Hastings show in five years! 

A major influence upon Krautrock, The Velvet Underground, The Mighty Fall and countless others, The Monks were the most groundbreaking anti-pop band of all time. Officially sanctioned by Monk bassist & songwriter Eddie Shaw Ye Six Nuns are one of the finest live acts you'll ever see. 

Their previous local gigs, at The Fratcave in 2012, 2016's Beatwave and The Fratcave again earlier in 2017 have all been 'sardine room' only. So come early to grab a space, hear the DJs, meet the Nuns and have a Nuntastic evening.

Supporting this Singing Sisterhood of Girl-Garage Primal Power are 'The Dirty Contacts' ...and get this Citizens - its their first ever show! We've had good word they've been profusely rehearsing their barrage of Classic 60's Punk Rock Covers  ...plus a couple of oddball numbers tossed in there too

on 45 Duty we have those fine Upstanding Upbeat Gents - Roy Williamson and Jimmy Kent, playing, what is without doubt the slickest collection of R&B, Soul and Ska disks within the Hastings Hemisphere. The Fratcave Villains with Vinyl will be accompanying the duo right through to the not-so-early hours of the Morning  ...yawn

All for zero bucks, as usual.

Enjoy a five-course meal in our opulent Beer palace with a glass of Champagne on arrival and one of our homemade glitter schnapps to see your meal off.

data.description:
• Shindig #10 •

/// New walls, new ceiling, new floor, new Marc Melià album, new work by O-ona Libens, (new glasses for Edith),…/// 

• Marc Melià, who played his first concert ever at the first Shindig, is back to present his debut album “Music For Prophet”.
It’s out now on "Les Disques du Festival Permanent", the label of Gaspar Claus and Flavien Berger.
For performing his music he takes simple ingredients: a Prophet 08 synthesizer, his voice filtered through a vocoder, and a limited palette of effects, to create electronic soundscapes and songs that evoke a sonic area between the classic minimalism and the cinematic music.

• O-ona Libens, our favorite Swedish-Belgian pré-cinema & shadow theatre performer, will try-out new work!
http://www.bruzz.be/en/node/141543

• Doors 16H • 5€ • drinks & snacks •
data.name: •• Marc Melià + Oona Libens ••

data.description:
Doors at 6:00pm | Show at 6:45pm

The almost-annual event that began in 1999--the couple took one year off for the birth of their twins— has become a tradition for their family and the families of their fans. 

Bruce’s and Kelly’s holiday performance finds the husband-and-wife duo of singer-songwriters with a full band singing songs from their Christmas album Happy Holidays. But the show isn’t all about the holidays, it is also a showcase of the best of Kelly and Bruce’s solo careers which continue to flourish with their new CD.

Bruce says the shows each year are very special to the couple because of the way it brings back memories, “You think about the people you love, friends, family, how lucky you are to have known them.” He understands the wistfulness of the season and the dream of a Christmas that may have never been.

#HolidayShindig
• Watch: “The Next Waltz”: https://brucerobison.us/thenextwaltz
data.name: Bruce Robison & Kelly Willis' Annual Holiday Shindig (Early Show)

data.description:
We are excited to announce our second annual “Spayghetti and No Balls” family friendly dinner event. This event will take place December 7, 2017 at Shindig Catering + Events. With dinner, drinks, raffle, and live music by Will Zimmer and Tom Berry, this event promises to be a fun-filled evening. This year dinner will be offered in two formats: take-out and restaurant style dine-in. Cash bar available. Take-out dinners available from 4pm - 6pm; restaurant style dine-in begins at 6pm.
Pre-booked tickets will be available at the SPCA: take-out dinner tickets $15 and dine-in dinner tickets $20 each. There will be a $5 increase for day-of purchases and children 13 and under will be $10 all around. We hope that you will join us for a fantastic evening in support of our life saving initiative providing low cost/no cost spay and neuter. Proceeds will go toward funding spay/neuter surgeries for pit mixes/large breed dogs and our feral cat TNR (trap, neuter, and release) program. 

In 2016, our spay and neuter efforts totaled 2,126 dogs and cats.  We could not have made this impact without the support of the community. Overpopulation is a major cause of homeless animals in our area; therefore, we are hoping that with your support we can increase our spay/neuter impact and in turn save innocent lives and reduce needless suffering.
data.name: Spayghetti Dinner

data.message:
Have you been wondering what those dots around campus are?! Wonder no more!!

We are thrilled to announce the 2018 SAAN Conference: Out of Turn. Out of Turn is the premier social justice conference at the University of Michigan, encouraging attendees to broaden their horizons and understand social justice from their own unique perspectives. Register here: tinyurl.com/SAANConference2018

I'm a programming director for SAAN this year, so I've helped figure out who we want to invite to conference! We have so many interesting speakers coming this year!!!! register!!!!

If you are interested in volunteering for the conference, please fill out this application! You will be compensated by being able to view some workshops in your free time, a shirt, and food! https://tinyurl.com/SAANConferenceVolunteer
data.story: Maheen Khan updated her cover photo.

data.message:
Hi! I'm part of the South Asian Awareness Network, a social justice organization on campus that means a lot to me. Our biggest event is an annual conference where notable South Asian speakers host interactive workshops and we have dialogues about our experiences with social justice and being South Asian, and how the two intertwine greatly.

For Giving Blue day this year, we are hoping for donations of $25 which will help lessen the cost of conference and make it more accessible to students of all backgrounds. We understand if you are unable to make a contribution in that amount and are more than happy with any amount received. (All donations are tax-deductible)

Please consider donating to SAAN!
